name: Yellowstone Lodge

reviews.title: Nice clean/comfortable place to stay
reviews.text: Overall nice, clean, decent breakfast and mostly quiet....our room was unfortunately above the pool area and we could easily hear the noise from the pool until it closed 10pm, so it wasn't that big of a deal. If we hadn't been directly above the pool, I would have rated it a 4.

reviews.title: Glad I stayed
reviews.text: A great place to stay outside the park. The staff was friendly, the breakfast very good, the rooms clean and attractive at a very fair rate. It also is in a quiet location.

I definately recommend staying here. Nothing spectacular-but it had all of the important qualities to our family of four. Clean rooms, reasonable price, and a nice breakfast with more than just danishes and dry cereal! The staff was friendly and the rooms were quiet and cozy.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
Perhaps the Best Accomodation in Town
reviews.text: We are staying here again this fall.

The Yellowstone Lodge in West Yellowstone is a modern, clean and functional hotel. The rooms are roomy and clean, the indoor pool and spa are nicely maintained, and the price is comparable with similar accomodations in other areas. It is one block off the main tourist thoroughfare so it is a bit quieter than some other locations in town.
reviews.title: Not to be Confused with Hotel Inside Yellowstone Park
Surprisingly great stay at a great rate...
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was well above average and everythng about our stay was similarly positive. I recommend this place to anyone visiting West Yellowstone.

reviews.title: Charm out the wazoo!
reviews.text: We just returned from a visit to Yellowstone National Park. While there we stayed at the Yellowstone Lodge not to be confused with the Hotel inside Yellowstone Park as some reviewers have written about. This is an excellent hotel. Very clean, rooms quite large, staff very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent for going into the Park daily. Very good continental breakfast. While in West Yellowstone, we found that the restaurants were quite expensive. The Outpost Restaurant was good and so was the Timberlane Restaurant. We would recommend both restaurants but be prepared to pay for your meals, especially dinner.

If you are desperate to stay at a hotel in West Yellowstone, pick a different one. If you are on a tight budget, then it is a decent choice; however, West Yellowstone as a town, was put there as a tourist trap for those who couldn't stay at a lodge in Yellowstone itself. If you can do it, stay in Jackson.
reviews.title: What a dump
Location, location, location.
reviews.text: We usually stay at Marriott properties so we generally know what to expect. We were not able to do this in West Yellowstone, so we decided to give the Yellowstone Lodge a try since we had read some good reviews on Trip Advisor.

reviews.title: Bullwinkles was great
reviews.text: Our room was a basic room but a little larger than some. We had a small refrigerator which allowed us to refill water bottles and chill them before going into Yellowstone each day. We did not use the small microwave but someone down the hall burned popcorn in theirs which smelled all over the third floor. I guess this could happen anywhere (including our own homes).
We asked for a rollaway bed for our third child. It fit well into the room, but the one we had the first night was broken and extremely uncomfortable. They replaced it for us the next day.
reviews.title: Oh go ahead. Just reserve it!

reviews.text: The biggest negative was the rough blankets. They really need to be replaced. The sheets were standard hotel fare.
reviews.title: Recommended for a good night's rest.

reviews.text: A calm, quiet, and clean hotel. The beds were comfortable. The employees were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was typical. My one complaint would be that they claimed to have a heated pool, if so, it was the coldest heated pool I have ever attempted to swim in. Overall, this was an above average hotel with decent rates and I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Relaxing atmosphere
Appaling
reviews.text: We stayed in the original hotel.

reviews.title: Nice hotel because it's new.
reviews.text: It was ridiculously hot in the room.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: The carper was fithy with what appeared to be a stain (blood of some kind?) and badly light.

reviews.title: good hotel/value
reviews.text: Not only could you hear every sound from the room next door but you could even see through gaps in the wall into the next room.

description: Yellowstone Lodge is conveniently located just three blocks from the West Entrance of Yellowstone National Park. We are also just one block away from favorite attractions such as the Grizzly & Wolf Discovery Center and IMAX Theatre. All area restaurants, shops, and other attractions are within walking distance as well!Yellowstone Lodge offers three floors with 80 spacious guest rooms, all with microwave and refrigerator. On site amenities include a complimentary continental breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and guest laundry facilities, as well as an indoor heated pool and Jacuzzi.
